tags: I’ll stan them till the very end of all things
thank you so much for sending this in!
it spoke to me on a spiritual level
summary: The scene where Jon gives Arya Needle will forever be one of my favourite scenes, ever, and it’s what helped etch the both of...
question: The scene where Jon gives Arya Needle will forever be one of my favourite scenes, ever, and it’s what helped etch the both of them onto my heart. You could tell how much they love and care for each other and that’s the first reason I loved them. They were a comfort to each other when they were made to feel like they didn’t fully belong, and that spoke to me. (Also, you daily posting of Arya positivity is so heart warming, thank you for posting them!)
answer:
JON AND ARYA ARE MY LIFE

I love everything you’ve posted here omg stop my heart can’t possibly grow any bigger (by stop I mean pls continue I live for these two)

Yeaaasssss I’ve rewatched and read that moment a thousand times omg

Every time I think about how much they love each other, I cry. Like, they both grew up feeling so lonely and ostracized and they found solace in each other and that’s just??? So pure??? The greatest relationship to grace our pages?? They haven’t even seen each other in forever but they’re always thinking about the other and I’m emotional

I’m getting all the feels right now, oof, thank you love ❤️❤️

(And ahh you’re welcome! I’m just so grateful people are appreciating them, so thank you for telling me! :) Arya deserves so much better so I’m happy to do my part ❤️)

spread a bit of love! send me your fav character + why?

blog.name: wolfprincessarya
blog.title: Arya of Winterfell
blog.description: sideblog dedicated to a little girl that is good & kind & brave & loyal. also the westerosi version of batman. maybe. we'll see.

tags: i didn't set out to make myself sob like a baby
this really got away from me
i just wanted to complain and declare my coping method of choice
i just needed to get it out of my chest
body:
of reunions and jaded hearts

so… let’s not kid ourselves. the bar is pretty low, but still, they’ll surely find a way to let us down. again. and with TWOW so far from the horizon, the stress is gonna kill me first.

but i am not gonna let it. no matter what happens on the show, Bran, Arya, and Jon’s reunion will be no less than perfect in my mind, and that’s final. it’s gonna fill our hearts till they burst, and fool us into getting our hopes up, against all better knowledge. it can even be kinda show-canon-compliant. mayhaps it even happens immediately after Sansa’s “Winterfell is yours, your grace”:

Jon had probably only just entered Winterfell, moments before Dany and her delegation did, with barely enough time to say hello and give a brief warning to the hastily-gathered welcome wagon of northeners, before assuming his king face for the introductions.

then there’s clamoring, the swift, repeated thunking of heavy wood against stone, and Arya wheels into the scene with Bran, at break-neck speed, all windswept and panting the both of them. they had obviously been hurrying to get there, and when Arya almost crashes them against a bannister the crisp winter air echoes with Bran’s startled giggles, beside himself. and then she almost crashes them again immediately after, as she abruptly halts, eyes wide.

 "Jon!“ she exclaims, joyful and earnest.

finally, our first glimpse of the real Arya. the one burried under all the pain and trauma of a tiny little girl who had to run and hide for her life for years, who witnessed her loved ones fall and innocents suffer and the gods fail her again and again.

next thing, they’re both running at each other, Arya shamelessly jumping up into his arms. her momentum twirls them around as they hold each other and laugh. when Jon finally gets his legs right under him he just stands there, all content, just stares up at her as she rests her forehead against his. their breaths mingle in visible clouds between their radiant smiles.

a polite cough brakes through their daze. Jon gently puts Arya down, almost reluctuntly. he tucks an erand strand of hair behind her ear and touches her cheek softly. ignoring the crowd about them as they awkwardly fidget, he then turns to his little brother.

"hello, Jon” Bran’s smile is sad, yet soft.

Jon covers the distance in two long strides.

–and, ok, Isaac is way too tall for this and Kit not enough, but in my head they’re not, and so:–

he sweeps Bran up too, and swings him around, and kisses his head, and hugs him close as all the heartache and pain and delight wash over him.

Bran hugs back twice as tight. he shuts his eyes and burries his face in the fur of Jon’s coat, and he lets himself be a boy that he had to forget how to be oh so long ago. he lets himself have this, just for a couple of heartbeats. maybe three. just three.

for three short heartbeats winterfell is not all covered in white. the wind still carries the scent of late summer in his memories, and Bran’s ears prickle with the noises of friendly sparring and baby Rickon’s high-pitched laughter. Robb and ser Rodrik are offering encouragements over the thunking of wooden swords, and their parents are just at the edge of his periphery, calmly seeing to the needs of those halcyon days.

He keeps his eyes closed for a heartbeat longer.

blog.name: asongofstarkandtargaryen
blog.title: Dracarys!
blog.description: Jon/Dany/Bran/Arya Stan. Salty about the got ending. Also likes: The 100,  Star Wars, Stranger Things.

tags: a post of ice and fire
summary: Isn’t it beautiful that when Arya and Jon felt like outsiders, like they didn’t belong they found a safe have in each other?...
body:
Isn’t it beautiful that when Arya and Jon felt like outsiders, like they didn’t belong they found a safe have in each other? Now, they are all grown up and have finally found their place on the world I want to see them supporting each other once they reunite.

Their bond is so strong and beautiful.

reblog.comment:
Isn’t it beautiful that when Arya and Jon felt like outsiders, like they didn’t belong they found a safe have in each other? Now, they are all grown up and have finally found their place on the world I want to see them supporting each other once they reunite.

Their bond is so strong and beautiful.

summary: Game of Thrones Random Challenge Favourite Season [1/1] - Season 7  This is the best season I have seen so far because it is a...
caption:
Game of Thrones Random Challenge

Favourite Season [1/1] - Season 7

This is the best season I have seen so far because it is a great penultimate for Game of Thrones and how the surviving characters including Jon, Daenerys and Tyrion have come this far. It has amazing moments including the battle of the Goldroad and the Dragonpit truce meeting. Compare to the first season, the special effects in Season 7 are better, thanks to the increased budget due to the show’s popularity. It is interesting to see Tyrion’s relationships with some characters. For instance; the continuing hostility in his relationship with Cersei, and his platonic bond with Jaime remained strong despite he killed Tywin and serving Queen Daenerys. I am glad they finally reveal that Rhaegar Targaryen is Jon Snow’s father and Jon is the legitimate heir to the Iron Throne, despite Jon’s parentage hasn’t revealed in the books yet.

summary:
For the record, if Jon were to be set up as an Aegon the Conqueror type, Arya would be both Rhaenys and Visenya.
Arya/Rhaenys:...
body:
For the record, if Jon were to be set up as an Aegon the Conqueror type, Arya would be both Rhaenys and Visenya.

  • Arya/Rhaenys: their brother’s favorite person, younger sister, kind, graceful, slim, playful, curious, impulsive, loves to ride, close to the smallfolk, flirty, and feminist.
  • Arya/Visenya: wield a sword, unconventionally beautiful, and knows how to make potions and poisons.

But at the end of the day, it’s Dany who is the closest to being like Aegon.

reblog.comment:

  • Arya/Visenya: wield a sword, unconventionally beautiful, and knows how to make potions and poisons.

But at the end of the day, it’s Dany who is the closest to being like Aegon.

summary: Daenerys, freaking out as they plan the meeting at Winterfell: John, help me out here, these are your only living relatives, I...
body:
Daenerys, freaking out as they plan the meeting at Winterfell: John, help me out here, these are your only living relatives, I want to make a good first impression!

Jon: Why, you didn’t with me and I still love you.

Game of Thrones Random Challenge  Favourite Deaths [3/3] - Littlefinger gets executed for murder and treason (7.07)

 I am...
caption:
Game of Thrones Random Challenge

Favourite Deaths [3/3] - Littlefinger gets executed for murder and treason (7.07)

I am finally glad this man gets to die by his throat cut with the Valyrian dagger, which he used to start the conflict between the Starks and Lannisters. Littlefinger is such a fool, blinded by love, because he thought Sansa is going to keep the murder of her Aunt Lysa a secret, despite it benefits them both. But when Bran and Arya comes back to Winterfell, he realises they will find out about his betrayal to their father, Ned sooner or later. He attempt to make a fight between Arya and Sansa and he thought he has Sansa in his control, and have Arya been removed as a threat.

The moment, when Sansa asked Littlefinger for his crimes, is a complete bombshell, and the look of his face is hilarious. It was a set-up, which is well-executed by the Stark children. Littlefinger realised his fear of being exposed has come true when Bran revealed his final words to Ned. His power has been taken away and he becomes a pathetic, vulnerable man while he tries to use his manipulation and skill in talk to defend himself. Unfortunately, he failed as Sansa admits she is learning and will never forget his lessons.

blog.name: ladytp
blog.title: Is this wasting time?
blog.description:
Welcome to my ramblings! She, older than you, Down Under, blogging about all the things I like.  If you want to know more, go to links...
_______________________________

summary: An old friend, as promised - and a new feature in fic posting... New chapter, “Contemplations” is up on my time-travel fix-it...
caption:
An old friend, as promised - and a new feature in fic posting… New chapter, “Contemplations” is up on my time-travel fix-it fic “This Time, We’ll Do Better” !

The reports he had received had not been able to reveal the whole story, consisting of several different messages from his little birds, relayed by word of mouth or a hastily-written scroll. Each account provided only one angle as seen by a servant at the inn, a soldier in the Lannister troops, or a merchant passing by the inn.

summary:
Arya: *on her return to Braavos* Hey, guess what, good news!I've forgiven you!
Jaqen: Interesting because I haven't forgiven...
body:
Arya: *on her return to Braavos* Hey, guess what, good news!I've forgiven you!
Jaqen: Interesting because I haven't forgiven you...
Arya: Oh alright, I'm sorry. There we're done.
Jaqen: My emotions are much more complex than that, I need time to heal. I don't accept.
Arya: I don't think you understand what just happened here. The only other person I've apologized to was my sister and that was court-ordered...

dialogue.name: Arya
dialogue.label: Arya:
dialogue.phrase: *on her return to Braavos* Hey, guess what, good news!I've forgiven you!

dialogue.name: Jaqen
dialogue.label: Jaqen:
dialogue.phrase: Interesting because I haven't forgiven you...

dialogue.name: Arya
dialogue.label: Arya:
dialogue.phrase: Oh alright, I'm sorry. There we're done.

dialogue.name: Jaqen
dialogue.label: Jaqen:
dialogue.phrase: My emotions are much more complex than that, I need time to heal. I don't accept.

dialogue.name: Arya
dialogue.label: Arya:
dialogue.phrase: I don't think you understand what just happened here. The only other person I've apologized to was my sister and that was court-ordered...

blog.description: 23/grad student/book nerd/ lover of arya stark/ Meera Reed defender/ searching for Edric Dayne/ mainly Jonrya and Gendrya

tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
summary: Something i see again and again in the ASoIaF fandom is that people who love Arya do so because she rejects femininity. As...
body:
Something i see again and again in the ASoIaF fandom is that people who love Arya do so because she rejects femininity. As someone who is feminine, i find this kind of annoying because honestly femininity has nothing to do with how i feel about her. So here are my top five reasons for loving Arya Stark:

1. Her empathy 

“The bars were too narrow to pass a cup through, but Harwin and Gendry offered her a leg up. She planted a foot in Harwin’s cupped hands, vaulted onto Gendry’s shoulders, and grabbed the bars on top of the cage. The fat man turned his face up and pressed his cheek to the iron, and Arya poured the waterover him. He sucked at it eagerly and let it run down over his head and cheeks and hands, and then he licked the dampness off the bars. He would have licked Arya’s fingers if she hadn’t snatched them back. By the time she served the other two the same, a crowd had gathered to watch her. “The Mad Huntsman will hear of this,” a man threatened. “He won’t like it. No, he won’t.” - Arya V, ASoS

“ It was even worse than before; Lady Smallwood insisted that Arya take another bath, and cut and comb her hair besides; the dress she put her in this time was sort of lilac-colored, and decorated with little baby pearls. The only good thing about it was that it was so delicate that no one could expect her to ride in it. So the next morning as they broke their fast, Lady Smallwood gave her breeches, belt, and tunic to wear, and a brown doeskin jerkin dotted with iron studs. “They were my son’s things,” she said. “He died when he was seven.”“I’m sorry, my lady.” Arya suddenly felt bad for her, and ashamed. “I’m sorry I tore the acorn dress too. It was pretty.” - Arya IV, ASoS

2. Her friendliness 

“ Sansa knew all about the sorts of people Arya liked to talk to: squires and grooms and serving girls, old men and naked children, rough-spoken freeriders of uncertain birth. Arya would make friends with anybody. This Mycah was the worst; a butcher’s boy, thirteen and wild, he slept in the meat wagon and smelled of the slaughtering block.” - Sansa I, AGoT

“ Cat had made friends along the wharves; porters and mummers, ropemakers and sailmenders, taverners, brewers and bakers and beggars and whores. They bought clams and cockles from her, told her true tales of Braavos and lies about their lives, and laughed at the way she talked when she tried to speak Braavosi. She never let that trouble her. Instead, she showed them all the fig, and told them they were camel cunts, which made them roar with laughter. Gyloro Dothare taught her filthy songs, and his brother Gyleno told her the best places to catch eels. The mummers off the Ship showed her how a hero stands, and taught her speeches from The Song of the Rhoyne, The Conqueror’s Two Wives, and The Merchant’s Lusty Lady. Quill, the sad-eyed little man who made up all the bawdy farces for the Ship, offered to teach her how a woman kisses, but Tagganaro smacked him with a codfish and put an end to that. Cossomo the Conjurer instructed her in sleight of hand. He could swallow mice and pull them from her ears. “It’s magic,” he’d say. “It’s not,” Cat said. “The mouse was up your sleeve the whole time. I could see it moving.” - Cat of the Canals, AFfC

3. Her childishness 

“You don’t even know what a brothel is.”
“I do so,” she insisted. “It’s like an inn, with girls.” - Arya V, ASoS

“ You know the words, but you are too proud to serve. A servant must be humble and obedient.“
"I obey. I can be humbler than anyone.” - The Ugly Little Girl, ADwD

4. Her leave-no-person-behind attitude 

“He’s going to die, and the sooner he does it, the better for the rest of us. We should just leave him, like he says. If it was you or me hurt, you know he’d leave us.“ They scrambled down a steep cut and up the other side, using roots for handholds. "I’m sick of carrying him, and I’m sick of all his talk about yielding too. If he could stand up, I’d knock his teeth in. Lommy’s no use to anyone. That crying girl’s no use either.”
“You leave Weasel alone, she’s just scared and hungry is all.” Arya glanced back, but the girl was not following for once. Hot Pie must have grabbed her, like Gendry had told him.” - Arya V, ACoK

“ She would make much better time on her own, Arya knew, but she could not leave them. They were her pack, her friends, the only living friends that remained to her, and if not for her they would still be safe at Harrenhal, Gendry sweating at his forge and Hot Pie in the kitchens. If the Mummers catch us, I’ll tell them that I’m Ned Stark’s daughter and sister to the King in the North. I’ll command them to take me to my brother, and to do no harm to Hot Pie and Gendry. They might not believe her, though, and even if they did … Lord Bolton was her brother’s bannerman, but he frightened her all the same. I won’t let them take us, she vowed silently, reaching back over her shoulder to touch the hilt of the sword that Gendry had stolen for her. I won’t.” - Arya I, ASoS

5. Her bravery 

“  Robb took them all the way down to the end, past Grandfather and Brandon and Lyanna, to show them their own tombs. Sansa kept looking at the stubby little candle, anxious that it might go out. Old Nan had told her there were spiders down here, and rats as big as dogs. Robb smiled when she said that. “There are worse things than spiders and rats,” he whispered. “This is where the dead walk.” That was when they heard the sound, low and deep and shivery. Baby Bran had clutched at Arya’s hand.
When the spirit stepped out of the open tomb, pale white and moaning for blood, Sansa ran shrieking for the stairs, and Bran wrapped himself around Robb’s leg, sobbing. Arya stood her ground and gave the spirit a punch. It was only Jon, covered with flour. “You stupid,” she told him, “you scared the baby,” but Jon and Robb just laughed and laughed, and pretty soon Bran and Arya were laughing too. ” - Arya IV, AGoT

“ She should be more frightened herself, she knew. She was only ten, a skinny girl on a stolen horse with a dark forest ahead of her and men behind who would gladly cut off her feet. Yet somehow she felt calmer than she ever had in Harrenhal. The rain had washed the guard’s blood off her fingers, she wore a swordacross her back, wolves were prowling through the dark like lean grey shadows, and Arya Stark was unafraid. Fear cuts deeper than swords, she whispered under her breath, the words that Syrio Forel had taught her, and Jaqen’s words too, valar morghulis.” - Arya I, ASoS

4. Her leave-no-person-behind attitude 

“He’s going to die, and the sooner he does it, the better for the rest of us. We should just leave him, like he says. 5. Her bravery 

“  Robb took them all the way down to the end, past Grandfather and Brandon and Lyanna, to show them their own tombs. Sansa kept looking at the stubby little candle, anxious that it might go out. Old Nan had told her there were spiders down here, and rats as big as dogs. Robb smiled when she said that. “There are worse things than spiders and rats,” he whispered. “This is where the dead walk.” That was when they heard the sound, low and deep and shivery. When the spirit stepped out of the open tomb, pale white and moaning for blood, Sansa ran shrieking for the stairs, and Bran wrapped himself around Robb’s leg, sobbing. Fear cuts deeper than swords, she whispered under her breath, the words that Syrio Forel had taught her, and Jaqen’s words too, valar morghulis.” - Arya I, ASoS
trail.content:
Something i see again and again in the ASoIaF fandom is that people who love Arya do so because she rejects femininity. As someone who is feminine, i find this kind of annoying because honestly femininity has nothing to do with how i feel about her. So here are my top five reasons for loving Arya Stark:

1. Her empathy 

“The bars were too narrow to pass a cup through, but Harwin and Gendry offered her a leg up. She planted a foot in Harwin’s cupped hands, vaulted onto Gendry’s shoulders, and grabbed the bars on top of the cage. The fat man turned his face up and pressed his cheek to the iron, and Arya poured the waterover him. He sucked at it eagerly and let it run down over his head and cheeks and hands, and then he licked the dampness off the bars. He would have licked Arya’s fingers if she hadn’t snatched them back. By the time she served the other two the same, a crowd had gathered to watch her. “The Mad Huntsman will hear of this,” a man threatened. “He won’t like it. No, he won’t.” - Arya V, ASoS

“ It was even worse than before; Lady Smallwood insisted that Arya take another bath, and cut and comb her hair besides; the dress she put her in this time was sort of lilac-colored, and decorated with little baby pearls. The only good thing about it was that it was so delicate that no one could expect her to ride in it. So the next morning as they broke their fast, Lady Smallwood gave her breeches, belt, and tunic to wear, and a brown doeskin jerkin dotted with iron studs. “They were my son’s things,” she said. “He died when he was seven.”“I’m sorry, my lady.” Arya suddenly felt bad for her, and ashamed. “I’m sorry I tore the acorn dress too. It was pretty.” - Arya IV, ASoS

2. Her friendliness 

“ Sansa knew all about the sorts of people Arya liked to talk to: squires and grooms and serving girls, old men and naked children, rough-spoken freeriders of uncertain birth. Arya would make friends with anybody. This Mycah was the worst; a butcher’s boy, thirteen and wild, he slept in the meat wagon and smelled of the slaughtering block.” - Sansa I, AGoT

“ Cat had made friends along the wharves; porters and mummers, ropemakers and sailmenders, taverners, brewers and bakers and beggars and whores. They bought clams and cockles from her, told her true tales of Braavos and lies about their lives, and laughed at the way she talked when she tried to speak Braavosi. She never let that trouble her. Instead, she showed them all the fig, and told them they were camel cunts, which made them roar with laughter. Gyloro Dothare taught her filthy songs, and his brother Gyleno told her the best places to catch eels. The mummers off the Ship showed her how a hero stands, and taught her speeches from The Song of the Rhoyne, The Conqueror’s Two Wives, and The Merchant’s Lusty Lady. Quill, the sad-eyed little man who made up all the bawdy farces for the Ship, offered to teach her how a woman kisses, but Tagganaro smacked him with a codfish and put an end to that. Cossomo the Conjurer instructed her in sleight of hand. He could swallow mice and pull them from her ears. “It’s magic,” he’d say. “It’s not,” Cat said. “The mouse was up your sleeve the whole time. I could see it moving.” - Cat of the Canals, AFfC

3. Her childishness 

“You don’t even know what a brothel is.”
“I do so,” she insisted. “It’s like an inn, with girls.” - Arya V, ASoS

“ You know the words, but you are too proud to serve. A servant must be humble and obedient.“
"I obey. I can be humbler than anyone.” - The Ugly Little Girl, ADwD

4. Her leave-no-person-behind attitude 

“He’s going to die, and the sooner he does it, the better for the rest of us. We should just leave him, like he says. If it was you or me hurt, you know he’d leave us.“ They scrambled down a steep cut and up the other side, using roots for handholds. "I’m sick of carrying him, and I’m sick of all his talk about yielding too. If he could stand up, I’d knock his teeth in. Lommy’s no use to anyone. That crying girl’s no use either.”
“You leave Weasel alone, she’s just scared and hungry is all.” Arya glanced back, but the girl was not following for once. Hot Pie must have grabbed her, like Gendry had told him.” - Arya V, ACoK

“ She would make much better time on her own, Arya knew, but she could not leave them. They were her pack, her friends, the only living friends that remained to her, and if not for her they would still be safe at Harrenhal, Gendry sweating at his forge and Hot Pie in the kitchens. If the Mummers catch us, I’ll tell them that I’m Ned Stark’s daughter and sister to the King in the North. I’ll command them to take me to my brother, and to do no harm to Hot Pie and Gendry. They might not believe her, though, and even if they did … Lord Bolton was her brother’s bannerman, but he frightened her all the same. I won’t let them take us, she vowed silently, reaching back over her shoulder to touch the hilt of the sword that Gendry had stolen for her. I won’t.” - Arya I, ASoS

5. Her bravery 

“  Robb took them all the way down to the end, past Grandfather and Brandon and Lyanna, to show them their own tombs. Sansa kept looking at the stubby little candle, anxious that it might go out. Old Nan had told her there were spiders down here, and rats as big as dogs. Robb smiled when she said that. “There are worse things than spiders and rats,” he whispered. “This is where the dead walk.” That was when they heard the sound, low and deep and shivery. Baby Bran had clutched at Arya’s hand.
When the spirit stepped out of the open tomb, pale white and moaning for blood, Sansa ran shrieking for the stairs, and Bran wrapped himself around Robb’s leg, sobbing. Arya stood her ground and gave the spirit a punch. It was only Jon, covered with flour. “You stupid,” she told him, “you scared the baby,” but Jon and Robb just laughed and laughed, and pretty soon Bran and Arya were laughing too. ” - Arya IV, AGoT

“ She should be more frightened herself, she knew. She was only ten, a skinny girl on a stolen horse with a dark forest ahead of her and men behind who would gladly cut off her feet. Yet somehow she felt calmer than she ever had in Harrenhal. The rain had washed the guard’s blood off her fingers, she wore a swordacross her back, wolves were prowling through the dark like lean grey shadows, and Arya Stark was unafraid. Fear cuts deeper than swords, she whispered under her breath, the words that Syrio Forel had taught her, and Jaqen’s words too, valar morghulis.” - Arya I, ASoS
